title: "You don't get banned for 1 game..."
body:
You get harassed and false reported across multiple games. 

I finished a 25 game chat ban and have been false reported twice this week.  One report even had a teammate lying to the other team that I am toxic and verbally abusing him. 

I don't verbally abuse anymore. I do get false reported for verbal harassment if I played poorly as the jungle, though. 

I had 1 game last night where a tahm ketch outdueled my aatrox. I said tahm is overpowered to be able to solo aatrox with just tank items. He called me a little *. I said I  called your champ op. I didn't call you names. 

Later, he and his teammate said that's how little * lose.  They then reported me for toxicity. 

Yes, this game, plus the other false reports of the week, all add up to justify an impending ban that I probably cannot avoid. You get verbally abused and targeted by bullies for saying anything. You also get reported for verbal abuse by these bullies when you don't even abuse anybody. You even get reported for a bad game, under the lie of verbal abuse. 

Riot, you need to be fair in the future review of my account. I have reformed and am reforming, and I am still receiving reports that will get me banned. I am behaving, and I will still get banned.

replies.body: You cannot be punished for false reports. For some reason a lot of people seem to think this is the case. We have stated many times that each report is individually checked for validity. You may get a warning popup telling you that people are reporting you, but this is for your information only. You have nothing to worry about if the reports against you are not accurate.

Why would he give chat logs for the 25 game ban? He said he deserved it. He simply expressed his concerns about being punished for a volume of reports rather than valid ones...which isn't true but has nothing to do with previous logs.

There are 4 options:

1. Your behaviour is toxic and you get reported -> Counts towards future punishments
2. Your behaviour is toxic and you aren't reported -> Doesn't count towards future punishments (unless they have an automated system which check chat logs even without reports)
3. Your behaviour isn't toxic and you are reported -> Doesn't count towards future punishments
4. You behaviour isn't toxic and you aren't reported -> Doesn't count towards future punishments.

Even if everyone in the game reports you, it just triggers a review of the game.  If your behaviour isn't toxic, then you aren't punished for it and the report is considered false.

Hey,

I feel like this fights against what Lyte keeps telling us, which is that community makes its own rules and decides what is allowed.

As an example, lets take a splitpush style player that rarely groups for fights. Player like this receives a lot of reports in various categories even though he is simply playing a different style. That doesn't necessarily mean that the player doesn't communicate, or does anything wrong.

Now in Lyte's way of thinking this is punishable, because the community decides he does something wrong(=gets a lot of reports). In your way the person simply used a different strategy and received a lot of false reports. These two mindsets completely fight against each other.

I believe that what Lyte has said is better in general because the quantity of reports is the only way to detect trolls that ruin games without it showing up in chat logs or stats.

Your post is entirely based on your presumption that those reports were considered valid. Given your history if that had been the case you would already be punished.
You DO realize that you're asking us to blindly believe in your claims rather than the system, right?
so there is nothing in the chat logs that would suggest that you said anything...perhaps negative or offensive?

Why wouldn't there be? He acknowledged that his previous actions were bad. He is saying now that he is concerned that false reports would lead to him being banned..probably because of past punishments already flagging his account.

You won't be punished directly from a false report. However, if you continue to be falsely reported and your account keeps getting flagged, and then finally you slip up one day and have even a SLIGHTLY negative game (say "gg ez" at the end and people report you for it), then you can get banned.

That's why you see plenty of posts to these boards (and what I believe your title is referencing) with people complaining about getting perma-banned, and then when they post the chat logs and it turns out they were kind of negative but not crazy toxic, the **go to** response is "you don't get perma-banned from just one game, you get perma-banned after several games, so WHILE THIS GAME might not have been so bad, your history of negativity caused you to finally get banned." No one ever remembers that in threads like these.
